title: A Prayer for Lifelong Trust
shortSummary: Psalm 71 is a heartfelt prayer expressing unwavering trust in God from youth through old age. The psalmist pleads for deliverance from enemies and affliction, celebrates God's faithfulness, and commits to continual praise and testimony of God's righteousness. This chapter highlights the enduring hope and refuge found in God throughout all stages of life.
timeline: Likely composed during the period of the united monarchy or later, traditionally attributed to David; reflects a lifelong trust in God from youth to old age.

keyCharacters.name: The Psalmist
keyCharacters.description: The speaker of the psalm who expresses deep trust in God, recounts lifelong faith, and pleads for deliverance and continued strength.

keyCharacters.name: Enemies
keyCharacters.description: Unspecified adversaries who oppose the psalmist, plotting harm and speaking against him, representing opposition to the faithful.

definitions.definition: A state of disgrace, shame, or dishonor; being put to shame before others.
A secure refuge or safe place where one can continually find protection and comfort.
God’s just and holy character, often referring to His saving acts and moral perfection.
To abandon or desert, especially in times of need or weakness.

outline.heading: Plea for Deliverance and Trust in God’s Protection
outline.description: The psalmist begins by declaring trust in God and asking for rescue from shame and enemies, affirming God as a strong refuge and lifelong hope.

outline.heading: Recollection of God’s Faithfulness from Youth
outline.description: The psalmist recalls God’s sustaining care from birth, acknowledges being a wonder to many, and pleads not to be forsaken in old age.

outline.heading: Prayer for Protection Against Enemies
outline.description: The psalmist describes enemies plotting harm and expresses a fervent request for God’s nearness and swift help against adversaries.

outline.heading: Commitment to Praise and Proclaim God’s Righteousness
outline.description: Despite troubles, the psalmist vows continual hope and praise, acknowledging God’s mighty works and teaching from youth.

outline.heading: Confidence in God’s Renewal and Future Testimony
outline.description: The psalmist trusts God to revive and comfort him, promising to praise God with music and declare His righteousness continually.

application: Trust God as your refuge throughout every stage of life, especially in times of weakness and old age.
Remember and proclaim God’s faithfulness from your earliest experiences to encourage ongoing hope.
Pray earnestly for deliverance from spiritual and physical adversaries, relying on God’s righteous protection.
Commit to continual praise and testimony of God’s saving power, using your gifts to glorify Him.

keyVerses.text: For thou art my hope, O Lord GOD: thou art my trust from my youth.
keyVerses.significance: This verse emphasizes the lifelong trust and hope placed in God, foundational for the psalmist’s faith.

keyVerses.text: Cast me not off in the time of old age; forsake me not when my strength faileth.
keyVerses.significance: A poignant plea for God’s continued presence and support in the vulnerability of old age.

keyVerses.text: But I will hope continually, and will yet praise thee more and more.
keyVerses.significance: Demonstrates the psalmist’s unwavering hope and commitment to praise God despite ongoing trials.

keyVerses.text: Thou, which hast shewed me great and sore troubles, shalt quicken me again, and shalt bring me up again from the depths of the earth.
keyVerses.significance: Expresses confidence in God’s power to revive and restore even after severe affliction.
